intro: Launaea korovinii, commonly known as the Korovin's leafcup, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent stems. The plant has narrow, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in its harsh environment. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Launaea korovinii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
